intro: Effusiella rostratissima, commonly known as the rostrated effusiella, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
